author: J. Walton
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 11, 2018
review_content: I bake bread at least once every two weeks, sometimes a little more frequently based on consumption, and always got at least a little bit frustrated with the difference in the size of the loaves and boules. I looked at a few of the different scales available on Amazon and was definitely not interested in getting one that relies on a watch battery and also wanted one that didn't round the numbers up. This Ozeri Pronto has a small profile, uses two AAA batteries (which were included with the scale) and is precise within +/- 0.1%, based on the testing that another review for this product was able to determine.This Ozeri Pronto food scale was used for making both English muffin and Black Canyon sourdough breads. The English muffin bread was broken in to two loaves and the Black Canyon bread was broken into six parts. This time around I made three loaves, using our new   Freshware CB-104RD 6-Cavity Mini Silicone Mold for Soap, Bread, Loaf, Muffin, Brownie, Cornbread, Cheesecake, Pudding, and More           and broke the other three into another six parts in total to bake with ham and cheese stuffed inside.I noticed two aspects about this Ozeri food scale, which I don't see as an actual issue, but thought I'd mention. The first is that when I was changing the bread and the tare weight was zero it turned off in less than two minutes, as it felt like it took me about 30 seconds, but could've been a minute, between removing the one dough and had to stop before the other was almost placed on the scale. Basically, you'll want to make sure that any and/or all of the items that you plan on weighing are very much at the ready, otherwise you might need to turn it back on and set the tare up again. The other thing to note is that the ounces appear to change in increments of 0.03, which can make it almost impossible to get a truly precise measurement, but is still pretty close.For the first time since baking homemade bread, all of the various loaves had basically the same pre-baked weight and came out looking approximately the same size too.This Ozeri Pronto food scale works well and I look forward to using it for years to come. review_content: Could fourteen thousand plus people be wrong?  Well - possibly.  I needed a replacement scale fast, and went for the one with the most reviews. review_content: I have only had the scale a few hours, but I’m impressed with the initial accuracy. We’ll see how well it holds up over time. In all the coin tests it seemed accurate to within a half gram— which is about as accurate as one would hope for a $15 scale and coins that have been used/worn. It was consistent on multiple weighings / different coins. It even fluttered between 2 and 3g repeatedly for a penny (which is perfect, since a penny is 2 and a half grams). The cell phone I used is supposed to have a weight in the range of 100 to 200 grams. (I got the exact weight from the website of the cell phone manufacturer). And in this test the scale was only off by 1 gram.The scale’s screen is a bit dim, but ok. I had to hit the tare button on first use out of the box (initially the scale read 15 grams when empty).. but not a big deal at all, and after hitting the tare button one single time, it was permanently fixed. I could see there being visibility/readability problems if a large object is being weighed which covers the screen, but I’m so far very happy at this price point. Will see if the quality holds.
